newsitem.title: USA: Nissan's '97 Infiniti Q45 price unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Nissan's '97 Infiniti Q45 price unchanged.

text.p: Nissan Motor Co Ltd's Infiniti luxury car division said its redesigned 1997 Q45 flagship sedan will carry a base U.S. price of $47,900, the same as the 1996 model it replaces.

Infiniti said the Q45t touring model, featuring a sport-tuned suspension and other features, will start at $49,900. Optional heated front seats are available for $400 on the Q45 and are standard on the Q45t.
Destination and handling charges for both cars remain at $495.
For 1997, the Q45 gets its first major redesign since the car was originally introduced in 1989.

Along with new exterior sheet-metal, the car features a new 4.1-liter, 32-valve V-8 engine. Although horsepower in the new powerplant is decreased to 266 from 278 previously, Infiniti said the new engine offers better fuel economy and more low-speed torque than its predecessor.

The car features dual front air bags and front seat belts with pre-tensioning devices, but does not offer side air bags, which some European luxury car makers are now offering in the same class of vehicle.
An Infiniti spokeswoman said the new Q45s are now starting to arrive at U.S. dealerships, and an advertising launch for the new model is scheduled to begin September 22.
